thread.title: Celtic withhold £35,000 worth of ticket money that they owe to Rangers over vandalised TOILET row
thread.title_full: Celtic withhold £35,000 worth of ticket money that they owe to Rangers over vandalised TOILET row

author: Liam Corless
title: Celtic withhold £35,000 worth of ticket money that they owe to Rangers over vandalised TOILET row
text:
Sport Celtic withhold £35,000 worth of ticket money that they owe to Rangers over vandalised TOILET row Rangers fans were caught on camera smashing up toilets at Parkhead back in September and Celtic say their rivals are yet to cough up for the damage caused Share Celtic's toilets were damaged after the Old Firm derby in September (Photo: Daily Record) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Celtic have withheld £35,000 worth of ticket money from fierce rivals Rangers after claiming their fellow Glasgow club are yet to pay for damage caused by their fans to toilets at Parkhead. 
Supporters of Rangers were caught on camera trashing cubicles, urinals, sinks and toilets, as well as pulling ceiling panels down following their 5-1 loss to Celtic in September. 
Four months on from their emphatic derby victory, Celtic have not yet received any money to cover repair costs from their rivals. 
Now they have taken the unusual step of holding back sums due after they received 7,500 tickets for the reverse fixture at Ibrox on Hogmanay. 
But Rangers say they may take similar action to their bitter rivals after accusing Celtic supporters of vandalising the Broomloan Stand as their side won 2-1 last month. The incident happened after September's Old Firm derby (Photo: Reuters) Celtic won the match 5-1 (Photo: Daily Record) Rangers supporters caused thousands of pounds' worth of damage to Celtic Park (Photo: Daily Record) 
It is understood the Ibrox outfit claim a section of seating was damaged but Celtic insist they have yet to see any proof their fans stepped out of line. 
In a statement given to Press Association Sport, the Parkhead side - who banked around £375,000 from their fans for tickets to the recent game at Ibrox - said: "As far as we are concerned the matter regarding payment for the significant damage caused to Celtic Park has been resolved. 
"We have not been informed of any major damage whatsoever caused at Ibrox stadium." 
But a Rangers spokesman told the Daily Record: "Negotiations around this issue have been ongoing and Rangers is currently evaluating the cost of damage caused at Ibrox during the Hogmanay match. 
"Responsibility for that cost will have to be accepted." Like us on Facebook
